name: Sheraton Suites Cypress Creek Ft. Lauderdale

reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed
reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights in this property with husband, 2 kids and in-laws. The reason I chose the hotel is, according to the description I saw on Sheraton Website, this is a two room suite and has a living ( with pull out sofa) and dining area. This should be perfect for us and of course its the Sheraton. The location is very convenient to the downtown area, walking distance to different restaurants. The negative thing was, its also near a railway. You can definitely hear the train when it passes by. The lobby was nice and clean and they have christmas decoration up already. The check in process I experienced was not good. There is only one agent in the counter and I have to wait for a couple of minutes. I asked the agent if what type of bedding do they have for the rooms. Thats when I learned that it is only a one bedroom suite with a separate living area or should I say a separate living room with pull out sofa. That according to the front agent is considered a two room suite, one bedroom and one living room equals to two rooms. I was so disappointed. How can I explain to my in laws that they will not sleep on a bed but on a pullout sofa? Well, I dont have a choice but to accept whatever they have.Then check in was done, I asked for assistance for my luggage. I waited for again a couple of minutes, cant ask the agent coz he is talking to another guest and then I waited waited..then I saw my husband outside waving for me to go outside. We end up just carrying all our things to our room without any help from the hotel staff.

reviews.title: Newly Renovated Hotel
reviews.text: The room interior is beautiful, new carpet, furnitures, two flat screen tv's, small dining table which seats four, miniref and microwave, very very small bathroom and bath tub ( had a hard time giving the kids a bath). The room has a balcony with a wonderful city and pool view. They are still renovating other rooms but its not bothering any guest.

reviews.title: Okay
reviews.text: I will recommend this to other travellers who will be going to Fort Lauderdale area but dont expect too much.

reviews.title: Nice Property
reviews.text: The new rooms are great. I stayed earlier this year and heard about the planned renovations. The new rooms are comfortable, good color choices etc. they replaced everything from top to bottom. Completely upgraded since my last stay. I have stayed at several hotels in the Cypress Creek area and this hotel now has the best rooms by far since the renovation. All rooms are one bedroom suites. If you have stayed before, I guarantee you will be impressed. Can't wait for my next business trip.

reviews.title: Noisy in florida
reviews.text: Stayed here on the way to a cruise, and after the cruise.

reviews.title: Nice, But.....
reviews.text: We were there for a cheerleading competition. The hotel was nice, pool warm, rooms okay. but every morning around 5 AM that freaking train would go by with the horn blarring. That was really it's only drawback.

reviews.title: Loved the hotel
reviews.text: I absolutely love the hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are not state of the art but they are adequate and was worth the money. I thought the rooms are reasonably priced.

reviews.title: Bring a Mask
reviews.text: I will definitely stay at this hotel again next time I go to Fort Lauderdale.

reviews.title: Nice hotel for 1 night
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for an extended stay. Although the lobby and courtyard are appealing, the rooms will make you sick. It's damp and sticky and everyone that visited got sick. Forget about the internet, only a few sites work. For the price, stay across the street at the Extended Stay.

reviews.title: Loved the hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a 1 night pre-cruise with my aeroplan miles on Feb 10th. This hotel is 20 minutes from Fort Lauderdale airport and was easy to find.

reviews.title: It's a crap shoot - and even the winners aren't that happy
reviews.text: Stayed there just a few days ago (2nd week of July 2007) on business. This was my second stay and our company uses the hotel through some sort of booking program so I had little (read that "no") choice in hotels.

reviews.title: Good Hotel, but not up to Sheraton standards
reviews.text: I will also offer up the thoughts of my co-workers who stayed there, as well.

reviews.title: We will never return!
reviews.text: The rooms are typically musty. My room the first time I stayed here was very humid and musty. This time, the room smelled very strongly of bleach. I would have complained but I figured that bleach was better than whatever they cleaned up with the bleach or whatever they killed with the bleach. Based upon the reviews and advice of others, I requested a room away from the train so I did not have a lot of train noise. However, a co-worker did say he woke up near hourly to the sound of the horn on the train. Unpleasant.

reviews.title: Fine hotel for a short stay
reviews.text: My room was clean enough though there was a cigarette burn hole in the comforter of the one of the beds. However, a co-worker called me today and is pretty sure she had bed bugs in her room. She is going to the doctor today to confirm - she complained the next morning of itching.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The center of the hotel is interesting enough with the fauna, water, and turtles warming themselves under heat lamps. Yes, the elevators are unbelievably slow and I think getting a decent room here is a roll of the dice. Almost everyone in my party said the rooms were musty and/or smell of *something*. Front desk people were nice.
Staff very attentive to our needs-Very helpful and freindly willing to make a good stay for us.
reviews.title: Great staff
Gorgeous hotel!
reviews.text: Got a great rate of abotu $82 on priceline, and it is worth every cent of that! Great rooms, comfy beds, landscaped perfectly. Location is not ideal but that would be the only downside unless things have changed in the past year or so, this is a top-notch establishment.

Ok ive written a few reviews already & sorry to this hotel this was the last of 3 amazing other hotels i stayed at & granted there were alot of people staying here because of the 04 hurracane storms but the location for a hotel is dire, the highway one side a train line the other & in direct line of the flight path, i live in lincolnshie home of more british forces per square mile than any where in the world air forces euro fighters tornados the lot, but this place boiled my blood to the max, at 4am when a freight train blew it `s siren i fell out of bed ...no bull. The hotel, pool, staff, faultless the people we met there were great there themed attreemed reception & food area beautiful little turtels in the pools in the indoor garden amazing but location dire..
reviews.title: rubbish location noisey beyond belife.

likes.liked: — i honestly cant think of anything possitive,

reviews.title: Beautiful but be aware!
reviews.text: This Sheraton is located just south of Pompano. It is very beautiful with the tropical foilage court yard, but that is where it ends. Our first room they put us in we noticed that it was humid and sticky in the room. We figured maybe the air was just turned on. After a few hours it was still sticky, we called for help. We told them we were going out to the horse track and could you please cheked the AC. When we came back they said it was fixed, well it was worse, it was midnight we were tired so they moved us to another room. When we arrived at the other room it was nice and cool, the AC was very noisy. This was the final straw, we get into bed and all of a sudden we here a train right outside our window. Please if you stay here check the room first and do not stay on the east side of the hotel the tracks are 60 feet from the hotel!

I understand last years hurricanes took quite the toll on this part of Florida, but I believe Sheraton has enough money to fix this place up. The room shouldve been much cleaner! The vent in the room for the air conditioning was not securely fastened to the wall. The coffee cups looked as if they had been just wiped with a dirty rag. The bed was quite comfortable but that was about the only thing that was really great about the room. The loby was beautiful but I didnt sleep there! There were cereal crumbs on the couch from the previous guests. All in all Im not sure if I would stay here again.
